channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump’s Turnabout on Greenland Shows the Limits of His Coercive Powers
item.description: President Trump’s faith in his ability to wring concessions by taking maximalist positions was on full display this week. So were the costs, as he spl...

item.title: Trump cancels Puerto Rico solar project designed to help 30,000 low-income families in rural areas
item.description: Javier Rúa Jovet, public policy director for Puerto Rico’s Solar and Energy Storage Association, disputed the Trump rationale for the move.

item.title: At March for Life, Some Abortion Opponents Want More From Trump
item.description: At the March for Life, Vice President JD Vance acknowledged “a fear that some of you have that not enough progress has been made.”

item.title: Storm Poses Big Threats to Power Grids Across U.S.
item.description: Managers of electric grids say freezing temperatures and ice and snow could lead to power outages in many places, potentially leaving millions in the ...

item.title: IMF chief sees global GDP growth as ‘beautiful but not enough’ to handle ‘the debt that is hanging around our necks’
item.description: Governments need to take care of “those who are falling off the wagon," Kristalina Georgieva said on a panel discussion in Davos.

item.title: Hundreds of Minnesota Businesses on Strike in Protest Against ICE
item.description: Thousands of protesters shut down streets throughout Minneapolis-St. Paul to demand that federal immigration agents end their weekslong crackdown. Bus...

item.title: Michelle Obama says friendships are as important as college degrees, job titles, and salary: ‘You’ve got to be really smart and selective about who you let in’
item.description: The former first lady says it’s important to make new friends, but advises people to be picky about who they let stick around. Longtime duos, like Opr...

item.title: As Winter Storm Fern barrels in, all eyes are on the Weather Channel. Its CEO is charting the company’s next big forecast: growth
item.description: CEO Rohit Agarwal says hype and scaremongering amid a dangerous storm are counter-productive when the company is building its business based on trust.

item.title: The U.S. has ‘escalation dominance’ in a debt war: Europe would face a violent market crash if it dumps Treasuries
item.description: Europe accounts for about a third of U.S. government bonds held overseas, or roughly 10% of the overall Treasury market.

item.title: Towering Snowdrifts Bury City on Remote Russian Peninsula
item.description: It’s the biggest snowfall the Kamchatka Peninsula has experienced in nearly 60 years.

item.title: Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen of Denmark Visits Greenland
item.description: The trip by Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen to the Danish territory came amid pressure from President Trump and appeared to have been meant as reassu...

item.title: Under Pressure from Trump, Venezuela Agrees to Accept More U.S. Deportation Flights
item.description: Venezuela’s interim government, in another sign of its willingness to placate the Trump administration, is receiving more deportation flights. Three f...

item.title: U.K.’s Starmer Calls Trump’s Claims About NATO Soldiers in Afghanistan ‘Appalling’
item.description: President Trump said that NATO soldiers stayed “a little off the front lines” during the conflict. In Britain, which lost 457 soldiers in the war, the...

item.title: Trump Wants to Build More U.S. Military Bases in Greenland. How Many Are There Now?
item.description: The U.S. once maintained more than a dozen. Now it has one. President Trump wants more.
